title: Ali-Shir Nava'i
summary: 'Ali-Shir Nava'i (9 February 1441 – 3 January 1501), also known as Nizām-al-Din ʿAli-Shir Herawī[n 1]  (Persian: نظام‌الدین علی‌شیر نوایی‎) was a Turkic[1] poet, writer, politician, linguist, Hanafi Maturidi[2] mystic and painter[3] who was the greatest representative of Chagatai literature.[4][5]
